main.java.clients
Class GameClient

java.lang.Object
  main.java.clients.GameClient

public class GameClient
extends java.lang.Object

This is a first client program. It demonstrates how to create a client socket and how to read and write information to it. This program determines what machine and port to connect to by reading the command-line. This is the model that will be followed throughout this semester.

GameClient

public GameClient(java.lang.String[] machineName,
                  int[] ports,
                  int numPlay)
Constructor for the Display client

Parameters:
machineName - The names for all the machines connecting to the client
ports - The ports to listen to for each of the players
numPlay - The number of players
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Collects information regarding the number of players

Parameters:
args - Array in the form machineName:port (the number of machines given represent the total number of players)

run

public void run()
Client program opens a socket to the server machine:port pair. It then sends the message "Hello", reads the line the server is expected to respond with, and then sends "Goodbye". After sending the final message it closes the socket stream.

usage

private static void usage()
Print the usage message for the program on standard error stream.

isLegal

public boolean isLegal(java.lang.String moveString)
Passes to board to check legality of move

Parameters:

Returns:
True if the move is legal; False otherwise
